SENT.plain: An 18-year-old woman with primary antiphospholipid syndrome developed a major cerebral infarction leading to brain death despite intensive treatment with steroids, urokinase, glyceol and heparin
Fatal strokes associated with this syndrome are rare
A computed tomographic scan of the brain suggested occlusion of the main trunk of the right middle cerebral artery
The titer of antibodies against cardiolipin/ beta 2-glycoprotein I complex in serum was extremely high
